item.title: QOL Upgrades
item.description: Tweaked my Lifemap page a bit more and added a Daily Note page for friction-less notes. Love how this is all coming together. Also in anticipation of the upcoming move, switched comment notifications to the public URL. üîó

item.title: Upset
item.description: Not quite sure, what triggered it but S was super upset this morning. She walked over to the ‘sun’ room and stood there for a good twenty minutes. And just like that she totally forgot about it all…üîó

item.title: 2025-Feb-23
item.description:
Trying to implement something similar to DayOne. Essentially a place where I can dive in and jot quick notes for that day - not having to worry about frontmatter, templates etc.

I might have to do some minor tweaks on how images are displayed here similar to the photos page…

M went over to the Jewish neighborhood in Centro Historico for the Post Language Program trip. S & I stayed back. Got some paperwork done for our visas. Walked over to El Jard√≠n Esc√©nico on Reforma and from there head over to Ehden Restaurant to meet the PLP group there. Some decent Lebanese food, a delicious date cake and a TERRIFIC arabic coffee!

item.title: 2025-Feb-22
item.description: Tinkered a bit with my Matrix installation. Upgrade went smooth but I wasn’t able to backfill my messages in Element. Looks like the rooms get added back in only when some new message comes in. No biggie…

item.title: ESC Gifts
item.description:
My colleague gifted me a walking pole engraved with everybody’s names as a going away gift. Loved it! The OBO RSTs got me some mezcal. Just in time before the packout tomorrow. Still got a week left here but boy, I am going to miss this bunch!

üîó

item.title: 2025-Feb-20
item.description: The packers came in today and boxed up most of our belongings. We’d already sorted stuff pretty decently, so they barely needed our intervention. Another team should come in tomorrow to load these out.

item.title: Last reforma ride!
item.description: Ever since we got her training wheels off, S has been nervous riding down the small hill near the Chapultapec zoo for some reason. M convinced S to ride on Reforma one last time today. She nailed it! Rode all the way to the Angel statue and back without any fuss. With the movers packing all our things this thursday, this would probably be our last ride on Reforma! üîó

item.title: Code Snippets
item.description:
Just a bunch of snippets for easy use elsewhere.

Building JSON output for posts with certain tags

{{- $tags := (slice "hiking" "add-other-tags") }}  <!-- Replace with your desired tags -->
{
    "play": [
        {{- $articles := .Site.RegularPages }}
        {{- $filteredPosts := where $articles "Params.tags" "intersect" $tags }}
        {{- range $index, $item := $filteredPosts }}
        {
            "date": "{{ $item.Date.Format "2006-01-02" }}",
            "emoji": "‚õ∞Ô∏è",
            "eventname": "{{ $item.Title }}",
            "link": "{{ $item.Permalink }}"
        }{{ if ne (add $index 1) (len $filteredPosts) }},{{ end }}
        {{- end }}
    ]
}

Read json data

Assumes json file is in assets/data/

{{ $p := printf "data/jsonfile.json" }}
{{ $data := dict }}
{{ with resources.Get $p }}
    {{ $data = . | transform.Unmarshal }}
{{ else }}
    {{ errorf "Unable to get resource %q" $p }}
{{ end }}

// Use jsonify to convert the data to a string
const jsonData = JSON.parse(`{{ $data | jsonify }}`);

item.title: Time
item.description:
We’ve got barely two weeks left here in CDMX! As with any move, we’ve been trimming our holdings down. Still amazed that I can fit almost all of my vital belongings into two 50 lbs suitcases. As a family our holdings weighed about 3000 lbs in total when we moved to Mexico city. Pretty sure we should be in that ball-park for this move too.

Made the tough call NOT to hike Orizaba the coming weekend. I think I just didn’t have the mind space to plan it all out.

Decided to let go of the 3D Printer I bought from a colleague last year. I haven’t had much time to tinker with it and it just sank in, I’ll probably have a tough time getting the supplies shipped over to Yaounde. Some indulgences - invested or not - are probably just worth letting go!

Tweaked my comments code to send notifications to my NTFY channel when this site receives spam - just for kicks. And boy, it does seem to work. üîó

item.title: Pico de √Åguila Sur
item.description:
I wanted to get some miles and alts in before we head to Orizaba next weekend. Decided on climbing Pico de Aguila since it’s just an hour from home. Hit the road around 0700 towards Ajusco. Since we didn’t quite have a working toll pass, Google maps took us through some inner roads. Boy, what a ride it was! Had we not had a local bus meandering ahead of us, I’m pretty sure, I would have chosen a different route. Having tope’s on a 80 gradient uphill didn’t help either. Just thankful we made it safely to the trailhead around 0830.

The moment we got there, I realised this was a different spot from when I’d done this hike with Mauricio earlier in 2024. We hit the trail soon and as expected we were huffing just a few minutes in. The trail, though well marked, was also misleading in quite a few spots. So glad I had the offline maps pulled up in AllTrails. At around 1017 we summited the peak @12,496 ft. The sky was super clear and we could get some real neat views of Iztachiuatl and Popocatepetl. Also maybe Malinche in the distance? We decide to turn around and take the same route back. After a bunch of wrong turns, we get back to the trailhead around 1200. Grab a quick bite by the quaint restaurant and make our way back to base by 1430. Great short hike with some rewarding views! üîó

item.title: Implementing static comments
item.description: I bit the bullet and setup a rudimentary comment system for this site. For the last few months, I relied on ISSO, but it kinda felt a bit too heavy. Finally scratched the itch and switched over to a basic form and some javascript to push comments over to my self-hosted ntfy server. For now, I’ve left the moderation to manual mode - I have to copy over the comments manually from NTFY to a comments.json file. A GO script that usually publishes this site also builds the comments for each of the posts as needed based on the posts’ permalink. Pretty friction-less and nifty! üîó

item.title: Boba Stickers
item.description:
Santa is so magical. Coz he knows kids would like it…

Exploring her boba stickers which she received for Christmas last year. üîó

item.title: Matamoros
item.description:
Back from a seemingly long but super-productive trip to Matamoros/Brownsville. This would be my last TDY while here in Mexico City. We went in body-heavy and it did pay-off. A good bunch of cables were pulled and cameras fixed. The weather was impeccable. With gusty winds, super dark and bearing clouds and temperatures barely hitting the 50s - It was perfect outdoor work weather. More so high up on an extended ladder!

Got to meet the Candadai’s the day I landed. They own a property right by a beautiful irrigation canal and this place reminded me of the serene back-waters in Kerala. I totally see myself retiring in a place like this!

M’s offer got rescinded because of the hiring freeze. Super bummed but I guess the writing was on the wall. Well, at least there’s a bit more clarity now and we can plan our home leave together. The new administration is pushing quite a changes. I’m all for productivity and efficiency but I don’t quite think they really see or understand the scope of what they’re pushing out. With direct impacts, for now it’s a wait and act game!

With the Matamoros TDY done, I can now shift gears at work and throttle up the check-out procedures.

Someone added Cliffs of Dover to the Barnyard Burger’s Jukebox. Been years that I’ve heard this song! üîó

item.title: Mari Gold
item.description: NO Mari Gold ! You don’t get to call - a wrap of leaf salad drizzled with vinagarette and some flavorless yam, doused in running egg yolk - a KATHI ROLL! Such a disgrace! Wasn’t too excited about going here initially and now I’m more than convinced not to look back once. üîó
